List.Item: = (for digraphs) returns true if digraph1 and digraph2 have the same vertices, and DigraphEdges(digraph1) = DigraphEdges(digraph2), up to some re-ordering of the edge lists.

< (for digraphs)
Let n_1 and n_2 be the number of vertices of digraph1 and digraph2 respectively.
Let m_1 and m_2 be the number of edges of digraph1 and digraph2 respectively.
Let e_1 = DigraphEdges(digraph1) and let e_2 = DigraphEdges(digraph2), after having been sorted with respect to the lexicographical order.
Then this operator returns true if one of the following holds:
n_1 < n_2.
n_1 = n_2, and m_1 < m_2
n_1 = n_2, m_1 = m_2, and e_1 < e_2 (with respect to the lexicographical order).
